creator: bschultz@bco.com
text:
Log4j stopped rolling log while program was running.

I had a program running that was writing to the log and after several hours the 
rolling logs disappeared and log4j stopped producing them. It is still logging 
but the *.log.1, *.log.2, etc... are gone.

Here are the settings I was using:

log4j.appender.sebLog=org.apache.log4j.RollingFileAppender
log4j.appender.sebLog.File=e:\\www\\logs\\sebdvel\\seb.log
log4j.appender.sebLog.Append=true
log4j.appender.sebLog.MaxBackupIndex=10
log4j.appender.sebLog.MaxFileSize=1000000
log4j.appender.sebLog.layout=org.apache.log4j.PatternLayout
log4j.appender.sebLog.layout.ConversionPattern=%d %-5p (%c{3}) - %m%n

log4j.category.com.yci.seb=DEBUG, sebLog
log4j.additivity.com.yci.seb=false

creator: ceki@apache.org
text:
Do you still observe this bug? Under what circumstances did it occur?
Were multiple appenders or JVMs writing to the e:\\www\\logs\\sebdvel\\seb.log 
file?

Until you provide more information, I am marking this bug as WORKSFORME.
